children.subject: CoE has had a similar policy for a year now. I think it's one course.
Where would i find this information for CoE?
in an appointment with your ESS Advisor. As it is an exception, It is not online.
Is there any similar policy for CoE?
No, I doubt you'll find a course that will accept you and you can be successful in during week six of the semester.
Any 2 unit LS upper course suggestion?? Since we can still add course I wanna drop cs189 and change to a 2 unit LS course to meet LS 36 upper units
For more information and to request a late change, please see this form: https://ls.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/advlatechangeclassschedule.pdf
how do we request?
correct, that would be a retroactive grade change, which is no longer possible I believe. You're welcome to check with L&S.
Thank you. I checked with my College Advisor and you're correct. He said that retroactive grade change can't be done.
Thanks for the information. Since it's effective Fall 2017, I can't request a grading option change for a course I took in a previous semester, correct?
This is a question for the office administering the policy/
i'm a last semester senior, if i drop a class and it puts me under 13 units, is that allowed? or should i talk to someone about it
I don't think that will make a difference. L&S will add you to the course on the back-end and will not see our departmental override form. You should direct these questions to them.

For late add class, I've gained the signature from a professor. But the class I want to add has a Monday time conflict with one of my classes. I've checked both classes, there's no exam/quiz overlapping, only lecture time conflict. So for late add, can I still fill out a Conflict Override form to add it?
Seems like it. However, unless you're a graduating student, I think it's wise to save it should you have an emergency and need to use it in future semesters.
So does this mean we can change the grading option for a class at the end of the semester (before dead week) if we wanted to?
I think it's unconditional. To be clear, it's not a "first time" request, t's the "only time".
For the first time, is the request unconditional? Or does it still have to be approved and we have to give a very compelling reason for it?
This request would not leave a "W" on your transcript, right?
I think you can just google it or find it on the L&S website
Where is the form now? The link isn't working--should I schedule an appointment with my adviser?
If we late drop we are allowed to be under the unit-cap?

history.content:
Effective this semester, Fall 2017, L&S has changed their policy for requests to make late changes to student schedules. Students are now allowed to request for late changes (adds/drops/change units in variable courses/grading options) once in their entire undergraduate career at Berkeley. 

1) Students are now allowed to request for late changes (adds/drops/change units in variable courses/grading options) once in their entire career at Berkeley. (one semester)

2) Students can request changes to up to 2 courses in that one semester.

Basically, if this is your first request, this will be granted. However, you should plan carefully because since this is only allowed once in your undergrad career, future requests will not be reviewed. (Previous exceptions granted does not affect your possibilities to do late drops this semester, everyone starts fresh.) 

For more information and to request a late change, please see this form: https://ls.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/latechangeclassschedule_sp18.pdf
history.subject: New LS policy for late changes to schedule
